chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Robert Schleisner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant may not possess or consume any controlled substance unless he has a valid prescription from a licensed profressional.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed,

The defendant must compy with his current sex offender registry and to register appropriately as a sex offender.

The defendant must complete sex offender treatment.

The defendant must complete and participate in mental health and anger management programs with follow thru.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing - 01/27/2015

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: undecided
#1 - JOC fom Milwaukee County Case #06CF4869

Defendant Gerald Robert Schleisner in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Gerald Robert Schleisner in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:02 AM. All parties have received the PSI and have reviewed it. Vorhees - PSI is accurate - no misstatements in PSI. State - no inaccuracies. State makes final argument prior to recommendation, offers exhibit #1 (JOC), recommends what PSI has set forth which is 11 years in the WI State Prison System followed by 8 years of Extended Supervision for a 19 year sentence. Vorhees makes final argument prior to recommendation, recommends 5-8 years of initial confinement with 335 days credit. Schleisner makes statement, apologizes to victim. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 19 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 11 years of initial confinement followed by 8 years of Extended Supervision, conditions of ES include: costs - paid thru ES, comply with his current sex offender registry and to register appropriately as a sex offender, complete sex offender treatment program, complete and participate in mental health and anger management programs also, maintain/obtain full time employment, no consumption of possession of any controlled substance unless he has a valid prescription from a licensed profressional, submit DNA sample with assessment - paid thru ES, not eligible for challenge incarceration or early release for stated reasons, counsel will retain their own PSI's, credit for 335 days (stipulated), right to appeal, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, adjourned.
Report
Sentencing hearing on January 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Called at 11:17 AM. Gerald Schleisner appears in person and in custody with attorney John Vorhees. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Vorhees states defendant will be entering a plea today and requesting a PSI and set for sentencing hearing. Vorhees - Schleisner will be pleading G to count #2 as alleged (delete repeater enhancement), counts #1, #3 and #4 are to be DRI. State agrees and moves to dismiss repeater enhancement on count #2. Vorhees and State agree. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1, #3 and #4 and amends count #2 to delete repeater enhancement. Vorhees explains to the court why the box was checked on plea questionnaire regarding medications that the defendant is currently taking. Schleisner pleads G thru plea questionnaire to amended count #2. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, continues bond, orders PSI, set for sentencing hearing on 1/27/15 at 11:00 AM.

Called at 8:53 AM. Gerald Schleisner appears in person and in custody with attorney John Vorhees. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Court appears via video from Shawano County - Court's appearance was changed to video later afternoon on 10/27/2014. Court does not believe it can do a PLEAS via video. Vorhees agrees and makes statement regarding PLEAS, defendant is willing to enter a plea today and does not believe a G plea can be held via video. Court agrees. Court is willing to come to Forest County this afternoon to take care of this matter. State is not available this afternoon for stated reasons. Vorhees and DA are willing to travel to Shawano to enter a plea today but not sure if FOSO can transport the defendant. Jailer Jaeger states he does not believe that FOSO can transport the individual today. Court can get here by 11:00 today if that will work. Off record for scheduling. Back on record, will continue this matter til 11:00 AM today and Court's appearance in person. Adjourned at 9:04 for now.
State's

ADDRESS INFO for Gerald Robert Schleisner
Current: 5979 Birch Road, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 07-17-2014)
Prior: 2324 W Mitchell, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States
Final pre-trial on October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Called at 2:48 PM. Gerald Schleisner appears in person and in custody with attorney John Vorhees. State appears by Charles Simono. Voorhees - will proveed to PH - moves to sequester. State - only one witness. State calls Deputy Hujet. Hujet sworn in at 2:49 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (2:52 PM). Cross exam by Vorhees at 3:01 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (3:08 PM). State objects - relevance and speculation - sustained (3:09 PM). State objects - relevance - overruled (3:11 PM). Re-direct by State at 3:14 PM. Hujet excused at 3:15 PM. Voorhees makes motion to dismiss counts #1 and #2 of complaint for stated reasons. State responds - did file Information that mirrors complaint but withdrawing at this point as it will be re-filing the Information with correct/different dates - asks Court to deny motion to dismiss counts #1 and #2 and bind over defendant. Vorhees responds. Court makes ruling - finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial - denies motions at this point. State - need ARGN date and will file proper Information shortly and possibly able to do ARGN this week yet with. State will get Information filed yet today and will recall the matter later today yet. Recalled at 4:41 PM with same appearances. Court now has Amended Information. Voorhees has Amended Information but makes comment that is probably the original Information and one has never been filed, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. State would like a sooner FPT date for stated reasons. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 10/28/14 at 8:30 AM.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Called at 10:17 AM. Gerald Schleisner appears in person and in custody with attorney John Vorhees. State appears by Charles Simono. Vorhees has complaint, waives reading of it. Vorhees requesting PH but willing to waive the time limits, will be filing request for substitution. Vorhees would like to address bond today. Court allows. Vorhees - bond - asks for lower cash bond for stated reasons, if released - he would be staying with his brother in Milwaukee, WI. State - bond - objects to any reduction in bond for stated reasons and is actually requesting an increase in bond to $60,000.00 cash. Court - bond - continues bond, watch mail for next hearing date. Court accepts request for substitution. Adjourned.
